abstract: Prosecutors in Chile charge Natalia Compagnon, daughter-in-law of Pres Michelle Bachelet, with issuing false invoices through her firm Caval in scheme to avoid paying about $165,000 in taxes; several other Caval employees have been charged as well, but Compagnon's involvement has proved damaging to presidential family.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors investigating a land deal said Natalia Compagnon, President Michelle Bachelet’s daughter-in-law, was part of a scheme to avoid paying taxes.

headline.main: Daughter-in-Law of Chile’s President Faces Corruption Charge
headline.print_headline: Daughter-in-Law of Chile’s Leader Faces Corruption Charge

snippet: Prosecutors investigating a land deal said Natalia Compagnon, President Michelle Bachelet’s daughter-in-law, was part of a scheme to avoid paying taxes.
